meanings.definition: A feature of a camera or other optical device that automatically focuses on a subject.
meanings.sent1: The camera's autofocus quickly focused on the smiling child.
meanings.sent2: I love how my camera's autofocus makes taking pictures so much easier.
meanings.sent3: The autofocus of the camera seemed to have a mind of its own, always choosing the perfect focus.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had an autofocus like a camera, always honing in on the important details.
meanings.sent5: The autofocus of the binoculars brought the distant bird into sharp clarity.

meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a camera or other optical device automatically.
meanings.sent1: She let the camera autofocus before capturing the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: Remember to autofocus before taking the shot to ensure it's clear.
meanings.sent3: The camera decided to autofocus at the most unexpected moment, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His attention seemed to autofocus on the task at hand, blocking out all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's skillful use of autofocus brought the scene to life in the photograph.
